message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CR, cs.CY, cs.DB

Reasoning: The paper discusses the use of persistent HTTP URIs in scholarly literature, which is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. cs.DL (Digital Libraries) is the most likely category as it directly deals with the management and dissemination of scholarly literature. cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is also likely as it deals with the retrieval and organization of information, including scholarly literature. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is another possibility as it may involve the use of persistent URIs for secure communication. cs.CY (Computers and Society) is relevant as the paper discusses the impact of author behavior on the persistence of scholarly literature. Finally, cs.DB (Databases) is relevant as the paper proposes an approach to alleviate the problem of brittle URIs, which may involve database management.
